The primary struggle of K-12 educators in an in-person school setting is keeping every student engaged and on task, until the completion of the assignment or activity.  The K-12 distance learning experience, necessitated by the pandemic, has taught parents how difficult it is.
MPS just texted that pre-K-5 are going back to in-person learning next month. 6-12 will continue distance learning.

@DrSurvivor Such an influence! I swore I'd never teach, especially high school. But, here I am.
That said, my mom had a scholarship to FAMU to play clarinet, but got pregnant, married, and stayed home. She was the constant "there are HBCU's" in my ear...thank goodness!

@CTrevorNelson Glad I signed up last night. All the teachers who want to get vaccinated are trying to sign on and are greeted by another limp response from @dougducey. We have school to teach!

@SJDJ @garydanewhite @leetramp @MsA_Physics @cossettej @RVieyraAEF @BarnettDreyfuss They are a friendly group!  Plus, I teach a section of HS physics at a local high school. I went to listen more than talk. There was a lot of good discussion

@money_teach My school is allowing teachers to start virtual clubs. It‚Äôs not the same as coaching a sport, but can provide an extra income opportunity. Also, if you really aren‚Äôt feeling the extra job right now, maybe that‚Äôs just not what you should be doing right now..

@VinGuptaMD I wish someone would listen to you about this, Doc. My son & his wife
teach at a regional high school every day...no hybrid.Never close despite so many w/Covid one case at a time & in NJ must have caught it on site to close. BOE & parents happy! Distressing. Be safe.Blessings. üôè

Bc I honestly don‚Äôt see the point in going to the school, daily, just to teach from my computer while trying to maintain my 2 year old daughter and my two school aged children, who are also virtually learning. I‚Äôve done that before, it‚Äôs damn near impossible .

@AustinISD Our city‚Äôs hospitals are overflowing. Cancel school, @AustinISD! If even one family is in an accident from the dangerous weather conditions, how will they receive adequate treatment? If a teacher is injured, who will teach their students with the sub shortage? Cancel now. Please.

@nityanayar @AustinISD The roads are going to be icy in the morning and teachers are required for the most part to teach in school, not virtually. They deserve to have their safety taken into consideration. So do the children who attend in-person learning and ride the bus without seatbelts.

Tomorrow I have to go back into the school building for my full work day and teach my (all remote) students from my classroom. I‚Äôm not very upset about it, but I have enjoyed the opportunity to work from home recently. I‚Äôm way more productive at home during my non-teaching hours.

"The union has said that no teacher should be required to teach in person until all school employees have had the opportunity to get vaccinated, or until the city‚Äôs positivity rate falls to 3 percent and its rate of new cases falls below 400 per day."

@OUSD_Parents @GavinNewsom Wow. Wow. I want every one of the teachers who get vaxxed before the elderly to look our kids in the eye and tell them why they refuse to teach them at school. And then go to a nursing home to tell those folks how they deserve it more than a 75+ who‚Äôs been patiently waiting.

You may feel PERSONALLY that you don't give them the same relevance, but there isn't a single medical school in the country that would teach otherwise.

@Principal4GT Mrs. Reeda Butler my Alg2/Trig teacher at Bayside High School told me the words that changed my life, ‚ÄúYou are going to fail my class‚Äù.  I my first nine weeks grade was a B, because she helped me everyday after school. Years later, I had the honor to teach her grandson.
